page.title: 17A farm in Hexhamshire.
page.content: {Oakerlands}(0.S.039405632)is a mixed farm of 110 acres,and stands about 550ft.above sea level between the Tyne valley and Devils Water.Until last year,Mr.Forster kept a dairy herd of 30 Friesian cows,but now he keeps store cattle on 35 acres of pasture land,rearing bullocks (Limousin,and Friesian x Aberdeen Angus)and a herd of sucklers,which he sells at Hexham mart,and 45 ewes and 80 lambs.He has 32 acres of arable land and grows winter wheat and winter barley and 33 acres of hay.The farm house and buildings were built about 100 years ago from stone quarried at Fellside near Hexham. Oakerlands probably got its name from the ochre obtained there,which was used in the tanning of leather to make the famous{Hexham {tans}_fine quality gloves made in Hexham until the turn of the century.
